user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtAssert_GetValueText:
```c
static const char *UtAssert_GetValueText(char *TempBuf, size_t TempSz, UT_IntCheck_t InValue, bool IsUnsigned,
                                         UtAssert_Radix_t RadixType)
{
    if (RadixType == UtAssert_Radix_BOOLEAN)
    {
        if (InValue != 0)
        {
            snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "true");
        }
        else
        {
            snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "false");
        }
    }
    else if (RadixType == UtAssert_Radix_OCTAL)
    {
        snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "0%lo", (unsigned long)InValue);
    }
    else if (RadixType == UtAssert_Radix_HEX)
    {
        snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "0x%lx", (unsigned long)InValue);
    }
    else if (IsUnsigned)
    {
        snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "%lu", (unsigned long)InValue);
    }
    else
    {
        snprintf(TempBuf, TempSz, "%ld", (long)InValue);
    }

    return TempBuf;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Rule 17.8 forbids modifying a function parameter itself (reassigning the pointer parameter), but permits modifying the object pointed to by a pointer parameter. In this function: the pointer parameter TempBuf is never reassigned and no other parameter (TempSz, InValue, IsUnsigned, RadixType) is modified. The only mutations are writes into the object pointed to by TempBuf via snprintf, which is allowed by the rule. Returning TempBuf as a const char * does not modify the parameter. Therefore there are no code fragments in this function that violate or need investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8.
